member_organisations: see www.f-e-u.org for list of participating member organisations
fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Trade, Competition, Consumers, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Youth, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Digital economy and society, Sport, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Communication
eu_initiatives:
We follow developments related to the following topics:  
 
EU Working Time Directive 
EU Fire statistics 
Civil Protection Framework and Mechanism 
Hotel fire safety 
Digital communications and PPDR 
EU policies affecting public safety 
Fire Information Exchange Platform 
Exchange of Experts
organisation_name: Federation of European Union of Fire Officer Associations (FEU)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
European Emergency Number Association (EENA) www.eena.org 
FEU is a member of EENA and a number of our members are also members 
 
Public Safety Community Europe (PSCE) (www.psc-europe.eu) - FEU is a member 
 
CTIF - www.ctif.org 
Many of our member associations are members of CTIF also.  
 
 
CFPA-EU - some of our member associations are members of the Confederation of Fire Protection Associations (www.cfpa-e.eu) 
 
EUROCITIES (www.eurocities.eu) - FEU has entered into a joint collaboration with EUROCITIES  
 
 
EFSCA (European Fire Service Colleges Association) (www.efsca.org)
relevant_communication:
Communications activities include: 
 
Publications: 
We have published our own strategic plan called Vision 2020. It was launched in Brussels in March 2012 and was facilitated by the Committee of the Regions 
It is available on our website www.f-e-u.org. 
We are currently updating our Strategic Plan called Vision 2030. 
 
EU projects 
We have successfully taken part in a number of EU projects such as  
 
FireComp (www.firecomp.eu) 
12 EU fire service organisations from 7 countries worked together to devlop a description of duties and tasks for firefighters, crew and group commanders in Europe.  
 
Safehotel (www.safehotel.org) 
Developed interactive safety training for hotel staff in 12 languages under leonardo da Vinci programme 
 
Multicom112 (www.multicom112.org) 
Developed language tools for training of control room operators in 17 languages and won European Language Label Award 
 
EUSR (www.eusr.org) 
Developed training programme for fire personnel in the use of special rescue equipment from heights and depths and in technical rescues 
 
Emergent (www.fp7-emergent.eu) 
Developed tools for management of social media in emergency incidents 
 
We have also taken part in a number of Exchange of Experts (EoE) programmes under the Civil Protection Mechanism in Spain and in Denmark
goals__remit:
FEU, the Federation of the European Union of Fire Officer Associations is an NGO set up in 1992 with the principal goal of enhancing fire safety and providing expertise to European bodies in matters concerning the development of fire brigades and fire safety in Europe and especially in respect of organisation and management, structure, technical skills, training and fire engineering so as to gain the most effective, efficient and economic means for mitigating the loss and damage to life, property and national economies by fire, other emergencies (including catastrophic national disasters) and all related environmental issues.  
The membership of FEU includes member associations from 23 EU countries and Norway.
